article.headline: Hawaii 91, Rice 77
article.story: HONOLULU (AP) -- Julian Sensley scored 21 points and Jason Carter added 14 off the bench as Hawaii defeated Rice 91-77 in a Western Athletic Conference matchup Sunday afternoon. Michael Kuebler added 13 points and Jeff Blackett and Paul Jesinskis finished with 12 each for Hawaii (19-8, 11-5 WAC). Michael Harris scored 18 points and Yamar Diene added 14 to lead the Owls (20-8, 11-5). Carter was the spark off the bench for the Rainbow Warriors. He scored 11 points in the first half and hit a 3-pointer that gave his team the lead for good at 22-21 with 9:18 left in the half. Moments later, Hawaii turned a three-point game into a 38-29 lead after an 8-2 run with under six minutes remaining. In the second half, Hawaii made use of its 14-point halftime lead, allowing Rice to get no closer than nine. Morris Almond scored six points during an 8-3 Rice run that cut the deficit to 65-55 with 10:33 remaining in the game. But Hawaii responded with five straight points to push the lead out to 15 points and Rice got no closer than 11 points the rest of the way.
